snippet: The president of the Boston Public Library resigned Wednesday amid a federal investigation into the disappearance of two artworks reported to be worth more than $600,000 from the library’s collection.
abstract: Boston Public Library president Amy Ryan resigns amid federal investigation into disappearance of works by Rembrandt and Durer, valued at over $600,000 combined, from library's collection; officials do not specify whether works were stolen or misplaced.
lead_paragraph: The president of the Boston Public Library resigned Wednesday amid a federal investigation into the disappearance of two artworks reported to be worth more than $600,000 from the library’s collection.

headline.main: Massachusetts: President Quits Boston Library as Art Goes Missing
headline.print_headline: Massachusetts: President Quits Boston Library as Art Goes Missing
